p: Different pharmacological experiments on in vitro and in vivo models have reported the ability of grapefruit to exhibit antifungal, antibacterial and antioxidant properties; these are in addition to the several therapeutic uses of the fruit juice [ 12, 13]. Moreover, phenolic compounds isolated from grapefruit have exhibited good antioxidant activity, while the volatile aroma compounds make them excellent flavouring agents [ 14, 15, 16].
